title: Printing the lowest and second lowest values in an array using methods (Java)
body:
Yes, you have largely missed the instruction in the problem.

The second method should use the first method to determine the best runner, and then loop through all values to find the second‐best (second lowest) time.

That clearly means that secondFastestIndex() should first invoke fastestIndex(), and then use the returned value to evaluate the second fastest runner, which I don't see in your code. Here is the kind of implementation that should satisfy it:

int secondFastestIndex(){
   //...
   fastestRunnerIndex = fastestIndex()
   //Run loop again on the array and ignore the fastestRunnerIndex while finding the smallest number in it.
   return secondFastestRunnerIndex;
}
